WorkItem.Description:
I would love if i could load different talentspecs into rawr, which are posted on theorycrafting sites in the internet or from other people as well as being able to export them and give them to others.
Â 
I think the most common ones are the wowarmory, mmo.champion.com and wowhead regarding the spec.format.
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request] Talent Builds, Import & Export to/from armory, wowhead, mmochamp

Comments.Message: uhhh... are you finding yourself unable to build the talent spec and then save it?

pure laziness of course.. It would be a extremely nice feature.. and while it is rather simple to recreate the talent tree in Rawr, it would be awesome to be able to have it parse a link and automatically fill it in. Especially since Rawr doesn't currently download your second spec when downloading your character from the armory. 

I too would really like to see this feature added to Rawr, it would allow us a quick way to evaluate if xxx 0 day elite dps spec is in fact better for us, then the spec we might currently be checking Rawr against. 

For instance, you've got: Unholy/Blood, Unholy/Frost, Frost, and Blood.. add in your Tank spec (also multiples), and you've got to manually add ~7 specs which is just time consuming rather then copy/paste, done. (and 7 is low, there's also AOE specs, rather then Single Target to consider..)
When new editions of Rawr are released, I lose my talents that I pre-designed
aury, that is a totally unrelated issue, you need to copy the Talents.xml file from the old version to the new one
UI Work is ready, need a back end. Anyone know how to convert a wowhead talent link into a normal one?
Import Talent Specs from Wowhead has been implemented as of 4.1.04, we will not be supporting other methods. The Armory pushes the takebt link into Wowhead for users to work with.
